description: From Yiddish שטעטל‎ (shtetl, “small town, village”), from שטאָט‎ (shtot, “city”) (compare German Stadt, Swabian Städtele), from Old High German stat, from Proto-West Germanic *stadi, from Proto-Germanic *stadiz, from Proto-Indo-European *stéh₂tis. Doublet of stead.

nouns.description: shtetl (plural shtetls or shtetlach or shtetlech or shtetlekh)

entries.meaning: A Jewish village or small town, especially one in Eastern Europe.
examples: However, you are right to suspect that there is some connection between my carefully considered opinion of the Hebrew people and this marvellous recital which your waxy ears, full of the cheesy gunk of the shtetl, have been so fortunate to hear.
